name: Citrus Adobo Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'lime wedges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'orange liqueur'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ounce', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'adobo sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'agave syrup'}
steps: Sprinkle chili lime seasoning onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with a lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into the seasoning. Fill the glass with ice.. Fill a cocktail shaker with tequila, triple sec, lime juice, orange juice, adobo sauce, and agave syrup. Add 1 cup ice. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds.. Strain margarita into the glass and garnish with remaining lime wedge.

name: Skinny Spicy Margarita

steps: Pour Tajin onto a plate. Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a glass, and dip the rim of the glass in Tajin.. Pour in tequila, lime juice, orange juice, and agave syrup; cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted, about 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled glass and garnish with remaining jalapeno slices. Serve immediately.

Fill a cocktail shaker half full with ice. Add tequila, celery cordial, lime juice, and bitters to shaker; cover and shake until outside of shaker is frosted, about 60 seconds. Place remaining 1 cup ice cubes in a cocktail shaker; pour in desired amount of margarita. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled glass.

name: Presidente Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt for rimming glass'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime wedges, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cubes', 'name': 'ice, or as desired'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'sweet-and-sour cocktail mix'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'brandy (such as Presidente)'}
steps: Pour 1/4 to 1/2 inch of salt onto a small, shallow plate. Moisten the rim of a margarita glass with 1 lime wedge; dip the moistened rim into salt. Fill the glass with ice cubes.. Pour cocktail mix, tequila, orange liqueur, and brandy into a cocktail shaker. Squeeze in juice from remaining lime wedge. Cover and shake to combine. Pour into the prepared glass.

name: Easy Frozen Margaritas
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'quarts', 'name': 'ice cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 fluid ounce) can', 'name': 'frozen limeade concentrate'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Cointreau'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'margarita or kosher salt for the rims'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime slices cut in half'}
steps: Working in 2 batches, place 1 quart ice cubes in a blender. Add 1/2 can limeade, 6 ounces tequila and 2 tablespoons Cointreau. Blend at highest speed until drink is almost smooth. Pour into a pitcher and repeat with remaining ingredients. Store in the freezer.. To salt the margarita glasses, pour a single layer of salt on a small plate. Moisten each glass rim with lime; dip each rim in the salt. Pour margaritas into each glass; garnish with lime. Serve immediately.

name: The Ultimate Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'Corazon Blanco Tequila'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'agave nectar or simple syrup'}
steps: Shake together all ingredients with ice and strain into a margarita glass.. Optional: rub the cut side of a lime on the glass rim and dip it into salt; and add a lime wedge to the rim of the glass as a garnish.

name: Margarita Jell-O® Shots
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'boiling water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(3 ounce) package', 'name': 'lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'triple sec'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': '15 plastic shot glasses, or as needed'}
steps: Combine boiling water and gelatin mix in a bowl. Stir to dissolve. Add tequila, triple sec, and water. Stir again.. Pour mixture into shot glasses. Refrigerate until set, about 5 hours.

name: Coconut Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tequila (such as Sauza 100% Blue Agave)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly squeezed lime juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier)'}
steps: Blend cream of coconut, ice, tequila, lime juice, and orange liqueur in a blender until smooth.

name: Watermelon Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'orange zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cubed seeded watermelon'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white tequila'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt or sugar for rimming glasses'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, cut into wedges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'crushed ice, or as needed'}
steps: To make a simple syrup: Bring 1/2 cup sugar, water, and orange zest in a small saucepan to boil, stirring constantly. Simmer until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes. Remove simple syrup from heat and allow to cool completely.. Place watermelon in a blender or food processor. Pulse until pureed.. Stir watermelon puree into a large pitcher with prepared simple syrup, tequila, and lime juice.. Place a small amount of salt or sugar into a saucer. Rub edge of margarita glasses with a lime wedge to moisten. Lightly dip the rim of the glass into the saucer to rim the glass; tap off excess salt or sugar.. Fill rimmed glasses with crushed ice; pour margarita mixture into glasses and garnish with lime wedges to serve.

name: Banana Margaritas
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'frozen limeade concentrate'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'triple sec liqueur'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'bananas'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarse granulated sugar'}
steps: Sugar the rims of 4 large margarita glasses. To do so, pour sugar onto a small plate, moisten the rims of the glasses on a damp towel and press them into the sugar.. In a blender, combine tequila, limeade, triple sec and ice. Blend until smooth. Add bananas and blend again until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.

name: How to Make a Pitcher of Margaritas That Stays Fresh
Parker's Famous Margaritas

Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a margarita glass and dip in salt. Fill each glass with ice. Strain equal amounts of the cocktail into the glasses to serve. Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Top Shelf Margaritas on the Rocks

steps: Make a simple syrup by stirring together and bringing 2/3 cup sugar and 1/3 cup water to a boil until the sugar dissolves; set aside to cool.. Make the sour mix by briskly stirring together the 2 1/4 cups water, lemon juice, 1/4 cup sugar, and egg white; set aside.. Combine the ice cubes, tequila, Cointreau, lime juice, 1 ounce of the simple syrup, and 1/2 cup of the sour mix in a pitcher; stir vigorously to infuse the ice, 8 to 15 seconds.. Run a lime wedge along the rim of an 8-ounce glass. Spread the kosher salt onto a plate and dip the glass rims in the salt to coat; add ice if desired. Strain the mixture from the cocktail shaker into the glass to serve.

name: Spicy Mezcal Margarita

Pour in orange juice, mezcal, and lime juice; fill with ice. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted, about 30 seconds. Strain into the prepared glasses.

name: Pegu Club Cocktail
ingredients: {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'gin'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'fluid ounce', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'aromatic bitters (such as Angostura®)'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime'}
steps: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add gin, Cointreau, and lime juice. Shake in bitters. Shake well and strain into a chilled glass. Garnish with a slice of lime.

name: Rhubarb Margarita
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced rhubarb'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'ice'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tequila'}
steps: Bring rhubarb and water to a simmer in a saucepan, covered, over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low; continue simmering until rhubarb breaks down and releases its juices, about 15 minutes.. Strain rhubarb mixture through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing pulp to squeeze out as much juice as possible. Discard pulp. Stir sugar into hot juice. Refrigerate rhubarb syrup until very cold, at least 2 hours.. Place ice into a blender; pour in rhubarb syrup and tequila. Cover and blend until mixture is smooth or until your desired consistency. Pour into chilled margarita glasses.

Combine sweet and sour mix, tequila, amaretto, and orange liqueur in a pitcher; stir. Pour mixture into the prepared glasses. Garnish each drink with orange and lime slices.

steps: Rim 2 wine glasses with sugar and salt. Fill with ice. Add an orange slice and lime slice to each glass.. Pour cranberry juice, tequila, triple sec, orange juice, and lime juice into a shaker. Shake well.. Pour mixture evenly over ice in rimmed glasses. Top with lemon-lime beverage.

name: Mexican Martinis
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'limes, juiced'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'coarse salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno-stuffed green olives'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers', 'name': 'premium tequila'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.5 fluid ounce) jigger', 'name': 'orange liqueur'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.5 fluid ounce) jigger', 'name': 'sweetened lime juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'superfine sugar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'crushed ice'}
steps: Moisten the edges of two martini glasses with a little lime juice, and then dip moistened edges into coarse salt. Place an olive in each glass.. Pour remaining lime juice into a cocktail shaker, and then add tequila, orange liqueur, sweetened lime juice, and sugar. Fill shaker with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into prepared glasses.
